RYAN WU

Software Engineering & Computer Science Student
Bachelor of Applied Science @ SFU

Game Development

Personal Projects

Several game development projects for fun. I find this to be a multidisciplinary learning experience - In addition to programming, game development involves software design, 2D art/3D modeling and graphics/rendering pipelines.

BUILDING 3008

A game developed in a week for Brackeys' Game Jam 2024 with our team of three. A fast-paced top-down shooter with fun progression mechanics. This was my first game jam, and the time restriction pushed us to delegate, develop, and test quickly while avoiding scope creep.

GITHUB

Gravity Well

A orbital system simulation project featuring 2D procedural system generation based on star type calculations involving luminosity, mass, orbital radii, and temperature. Challenges involved optimization of gravital calculations and predictions of ship trajectory.

GITHUB

Aeronaut

An airship combat project featuring tactical combat and aerial maneuvering. 3D models were made in Blender, terrain was made with Worldmachine.

GITHUB

Bloodmarine

Top-down horde shooter in a procedurally generation dungeon. A focus on physics, shadow casting, rendering and shaders. shadows are dynamically raycasted and rendering layers are used to hide enemies until entering the light.

GITHUB

Fishgame

A simple hand-drawn fish game in Processing.
